data.title: About World Famous Studios
data.text:
Pete deBoer

Pete's passion for audio started over 30 years ago. He played instruments at a young age, was in bands throughout high school and started doing live sound for national acts his Junior year. Immediately after High School Pete moved to NYC to attended the Institute of Audio Research in Greenwich Village and started his career working at several prominent NYC recording studios.

Ninja skills on Pro Tools (an operator since Ver.4 and the first 24bit system), a strong understanding of recording technology, and a talent for getting ideal sounds has led to Pete working with many famous producers including Mark Plati (David Bowie, The Cure, Duncan Sheik), Dave Sardy (Marilyn Manson, Nine Inch Nails, Rage Against the Machine), Tommy Ramone (Ramones), Desmond Child (Aerosmith, Alice Cooper, Kiss).

As well as a decade travelling, learning from and working alongside famed producer Ron Saint Germain (311, Tool, Soundgarden, Muse, Jimi Hendrix) resulting in a Platinum album, several Billboard charting singles and a few co-productions.

Pete has had the pleasure of working with artist: Norah Jones, Living Colour, Default, Brand New, Crash Test Dummies, Rufus Wainright, Glen Hansard, Creed, George Clinton & the P-Funk All-Stars, Scott Stapp, Q-Tip, DMC (including performances by Elliot Easton, Joey Kramer and Josh Todd), The Exit, Ollabelle, Biohazard, Kim Taylor and Morningwood as some of the highlights.

Like most accomplished Audio Engineers, Pete has nurtured an intense interest in music throughout his life.

Harnessing the skills of both the ever evolving digital age, as well as a continuing love affair with analog, and all other classic production methods.

Click any button below to Contact Pete

John Pysner

Originally a solo artist under the moniker Anahedron), John eventually went on to obtain a Bachelors in Music Production from Full Sail University.

In 2013, after relocating to Denver, John joined World Famous Studios as an apprentice and assistant engineer. With this diverse background, John is experienced in everything from composition and sound design to recording and engineering.

John loves all styles and is a prolific writer. Having a diverse musical background and access to a wealth of instrumentation, John incorporates everything from live drums to generative synthesis in his pieces. He has worked with artists such as Crickets Make Math, Buddhasandwich, and Justin Mortelliti.

Jason Sutter

Jason is a lifelong musician & multi-instrumentalist and has been in or working with bands since the early 90’s. A former member of Black Iron Prison and Church of the Black Locust. He has decades of experience producing live and studio recordings.

Jason is the current guitarist and founding member of Doom Super Group Turncoat Mercenaries. A true music lover, Jay enjoys listening to and collecting vinyl.

Jason moved to Colorado from New York in 2012. He joined the team at World Famous as an Engineer/Producer before relocating to Denver.

Jason is now available for scheduling

Check Back Soon for Full Bio

Click any button below to Contact Jason

Hapa

Hapa, your brown and very eager to please studio dog, started sleeping on the couch in 2011 and hasn’t left since.

She'll greet you enthusiastically at the door and she loves to observe every aspect of your session and won’t bite her tongue when she hears something wrong.

She likes to be tipped in Bacon or Cheese...

Preferably Both.

She's your go-to gal at the studio and always close by.

She's always willing to go and hang out on the patio and play some frisbee or just lay by your feet as you record. A true music lover she's always been there to give encouragement if you need it.

Click any button below to Contact Hapa
